title: Will a chapter 7 bankruptcy defeat a lawsuit against me from the City Attorney for vandalism they allege my minor child committe
question: I am already in a 7 for other reasons. Not sure if they will get any special protection because they are governmental.
answers:
There is an exception to discharge for the "willful and malicious injury by the debtor to another entity or to the property of another entity;" Because you are the debtor and your son committed the act, your liability would be dischargeable (unless you instructed him or caused him to do it).

This is a fairly interesting question, while the vandalism might not be dis-chargeable against your son you should be able to discharge the debt since you are most likely only being pursued for negligent supervision not an intentional act.
